#Text=Karen Kane
#Text=Karen Kane is an American fashion designer .
#Text=Her designs are known for their relaxed , California-inspired feeling . [ 4 ]
#Text=Personal life
#Text=Kane was born in the Akron suburb Barberton , Ohio , the youngest of three children . [ 5 ]
#Text=At the age of 9 , her family moved from Ohio to Santa Barbara , California , where she grew up sewing and taking as many fashion-related classes as possible . [ 6 ]
#Text=Today , Kane lives in Los Angeles with her husband , Lonnie , and runs her namesake clothing company out of Vernon , California . [ 7 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Karen Kane started her career in fashion when she graduated from the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising in Los Angeles at the age of 19 .
#Text=Her first job was as a pattern maker at a junior sportswear company .
#Text=It was there that she met her husband and future business partner , Lonnie . [ 8 ]
#Text=In 1979 , Karen and Lonnie married and launched the Karen Kane womenswear collection out of their Studio City garage . [ 9 ]

#Text=Initially , the brand was sold only at smaller specialty stores , but as the line expanded , it was picked up by department stores like Macy ’s , Belk , Bloomingdales , Dillard ’s , Lord & Taylor , Nordstrom , and Von Maur .
#Text=The line continues to be sold at each of these retailers , as well as online retailers such as Amazon , Zappos , Stitch Fix , and large national specialty stores .
#Text=Kane 's clothing is most well known for having an easy , relaxed style that is reflective of her native California . [ 10 ]
#Text=Her corporate mission statement reads : " We believe women should feel beautiful and comfortable , always .

#Text=In 2012 , she was invited to the White House to attend US President Barack Obama 's  Insourcing American Jobs " summit and later that year , US Trade Representative Demetrios Marantis toured Kane 's headquarters in California to learn more about the challenges of domestically manufacturing apparel in the United States . [ 12 ]

column1: #Text=In 2011 , 80 % of Kane ’s line was made in the United States and 20 % was imported from other countries . [ 13 ]
#Text=In Spring 2012 , that percentage increased to 90 % . [ 14 ]
#Text=As of Fall 2013 , Kane continued to manufacture most of her collection in the United States ( primarily in Southern California ) . [ 15 ]
#Text=In addition to her namesake collection , Kane also designs ' Karen by Karen Kane , ' which includes casual , activewear-inspired items . [ 16 ]
#Text=In addition , Kane also produces a plus size division of the lifestyle collection entitled Karen Kane Women ’s .
#Text=In 2013 , Kane added a sixth division to her company : Robert Michaels .
#Text=Named for her two sons ( Michael [ 17 ] & Robert ) , the collection consists of knit dresses , tops , and sweaters , and is sold exclusively at Bloomingdale 's . [ 18 ]
#Text=Kane also designs a contemporary label .
#Text=In 2008 , she launched Fifteen Twenty , which was a collection of assorted separates primarily made of silk .

#Text=The brand has been worn by celebrities such as Reese Witherspoon , [ 19 ] Jessica Biel , [ 20 ] Carrie Underwood , [ 21 ] Jessica Alba , [ 22 ] Rosie Huntington-Whiteley , [ 23 ] Alessandra Ambrosio , [ 24 ] and others .
#Text=Fifteen Twenty is sold in high-end specialty stores and online boutiques such as Neiman Marcus , Rent The Runway , and Bloomingdales .
#Text=In 2011 , Kane introduced a casual complement to her Fifteen Twenty line entitled Red 23 .
#Text=“ The line of T-shirts , tank tops , sweaters , jackets and scarves in neutral colors…will be carried by high-end specialty stores . ” [ 25 ]
#Text=In 2015 , Red 23 was absorbed into Fifteen Twenty to broaden the main brand into a larger collection .
#Text=Today , Fifteen Twenty is a full collection of tops , jackets , dresses , skirts , and pants .
#Text=In 2013 , Kane selected IMG ( company ) to represent the brand in developing licensed products . [ 26 ]
#Text=Kane 's eyewear collection has become one of the most successful licenses for its manufacturer , ROI . [ 27 ]
#Text=Family
#Text=Karen , pictured with her husband Lonnie , and son Michael , in her Los Angeles design studio , 2017
#Text=Unlike most other designers of her generation , Kane chose not to sell the rights to her brand ; her company continues to be privately owned and family operated . [ 28 ]
#Text=In addition to his role as president of Karen Kane , Kane 's husband , Lonnie , currently serves as the Chairman of the California Fashion Association . [ 29 ]
#Text=Karen and Lonnie 's older son , Michael , serves as the brand 's Director of Marketing .
#Text=Their younger son , Robert , attended Parsons School of Design between 2012-2016.
#Text=In 2010 , he designed a line of t-shirts that appeared in the ' Karen by Karen Kane ' summer collection . [ 30 ]
